Jokowi Malu, Pacul Saja Masih Impor!
06 Nov 2019, 05:28 by Hendra Kusuma


Foto: Edi Wahyono

Jakarta - Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi) mengaku malu di depan para bankir yang hadir dalam acara Indonesia Banking Expo 2019 di Hotel Fairmont, Jakarta, Rabu (6/11/2019).Rasa malu Jokowi dipicu masih banyaknya barang impor yang masuk Indonesia. Lebih malu lagi, barang yang diimpor ternyata barang sederhana seperti pacul."Urusan pacul, cangkul, masak masih impor!" tegas Jokowi dalam pidatonya saat membuka acara tersebut.Ia pun lalu menantang pejabat terkait untuk mendorong pertumbuhan industri usaha kecil dan menengah yang bisa memproduksi barang-barang sederhana tadi."Apakah tidak bisa didesain industri UKM kita kamu buat pacul? Tahun depan saya beli," tegas Jokowi.Ia pun meminta pelaku usaha tak perlu khawatir tak punya pasar. Toh buktinya selama ini RI masih mengimpor banyak pacul.Artinya, bila ada industri yang mau masuk ke sektor produksi cangkul, peluang ekonominya masih sangat besar. Bila masih mengandalkan impor, maka peluang itu hanya akan dinikmati pihak asing."Ini puluhan ribu ratusan ribu cangkul yang dibutuhkan masih impor. apakah negara kita yang sebesar ini industrinya yang sudah berkembang benar pacul cangkul harus impor?" tandasnya. text:
Shame Jokowi, Pacul Only Still Imports!
Nov 6 2019, 05:28 by Hendra Kusuma


Photo: Edi Wahyono

Jakarta - President Joko Widodo (Jokowi) claimed to be embarrassed in front of the bankers who attended the 2019 Indonesia Banking Expo at the Fairmont Hotel, Jakarta, Wednesday (6/11/2019). Jokowi's shame was triggered by the large number of imported goods entering Indonesia. Even more ashamed, imported goods turned out to be simple items like hoes. "Matters, hoes, and cooking are still imported!" Jokowi stressed in his speech when opening the event. He then challenged the relevant officials to encourage the growth of the small and medium business industry that can produce simple goods earlier. "Can you design our SME industry to hoe? Next year I buy," Jokowi said. He also asked businesspeople not to worry about not having a market. After all, the evidence so far is that Indonesia still imports a lot of hoes. That is, if there is an industry that wants to enter the hoe production sector, the economic opportunity is still very large. If you still rely on imports, then the opportunity will only be enjoyed by foreign parties. "These tens of thousands of hundreds of thousands of hoes needed are still imported. Is our country that is as big as this industry that has already developed hoe hoe should be imported?" he said.
